member.name: M:Wsus_Package_Publisher.RuleRegSzToVersion.GetVersionNumber(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Return a part of the string, corresponding of a sub-version number. Eg : For version = "2.12.0.202" and rank = 3, return "202"
member.param: The full version string.
Determine witch sub-version number to return (starting at 0).
member.returns: Return a Integer corresponding to the sub-version number

member.name: P:Wsus_Package_Publisher.Resources.Resources.DescriptionInformationsWizard
member.summary:
Recherche une chaîne localisée semblable à Indicate here the informations about the update. Fields in bold are required.
Vendor Name (Required): It is here that you define the name of the publisher of the update. For example: Oracle, Sun, Symantec, Adobe ...
Product Name (Required): Name of the upgraded product. For example: Java, Endpoint Protection 12, Flash Player ...
Title (Required): It is here that you define the title of the update. For example: Java 6 update 31, Symantec Endpoint Protection 12.1 MP1 RU1, Flash Player 11.2.0.233 ... [le reste de la chaîne a été tronqué]";.

member.name: P:Wsus_Package_Publisher.Resources.Resources.DescriptionUpdateFileWizard
member.summary:
Recherche une chaîne localisée semblable à Indicate here the file or files to create the update. Fields in bold are required.
File update (Required): Select a msi, msp or exe file corresponding to the binary update.
Additional files (Optional): Select a file or files needed for the application of the update. For example configuration files or answer file.
Command line (Optional): Indicate one or more parameters for the file update. Eg /q /s or /silent. For Msi file it is not necessary to specify the option to make the installation silent. [le reste de la chaîne a été tronqué]";.

member.name: P:Wsus_Package_Publisher.Resources.Resources.openFileDialogueUpdateFile
member.summary: Recherche une chaîne localisée semblable à All accepted files|*.msi;*.msp;*.exe|MSI Files|*.msi|MSP Files|*.msp|EXE Files|*.exe.

member.summary: Get or Set the Name of this Column.

member.name: P:Wsus_Package_Publisher.MSIPropertyReader.Column.Nullable
member.summary: Identifies whether the column may contain a Null value. This column may have one of the following values : Y : Yes, the column may have a Null value. N : No, the column may not have a Null value.

member.name: P:Wsus_Package_Publisher.MSIPropertyReader.Column.MinValue
member.summary: This field applies to columns having numeric value. The field contains the minimum permissible value. This can be the minimum value for an integer or the minimum value for a date or version string.

member.name: P:Wsus_Package_Publisher.MSIPropertyReader.Column.MaxValue
member.summary: This field applies to columns having numeric value. The field is the maximum permissible value. This may be the maximum value for an integer or the maximum value for a date or version string.

member.name: P:Wsus_Package_Publisher.MSIPropertyReader.Column.KeyTable
member.summary: This field applies to columns that are external keys. The field identified in Column must link to the column number specified by KeyColumn in the table named in KeyTable. This can be a list of tables separated by semicolons.

member.name: P:Wsus_Package_Publisher.MSIPropertyReader.Column.KeyColumn
member.summary: This field applies to table columns that are external keys. The field identified in Column must link to the column number specified by KeyColumn in the table named in KeyTable. The permissible range of the KeyColumn field is 1-32.

member.name: P:Wsus_Package_Publisher.MSIPropertyReader.Column.Category
member.summary: This is the type of data contained by the database field specified by the Table and Column columns of the _Validation table. If this is a type having a numeric value, such as Integer, DoubleInteger or Time/Date, then enter null into this field and specify the value's range using the MinValue and MaxValue columns. Use the Category column to specify the non-numeric data types described in Column Data Types.

member.name: P:Wsus_Package_Publisher.MSIPropertyReader.Column.Set
member.summary: This is a list of permissible values for this field separated by semicolons. This field is usually used for enumerations.

member.name: P:Wsus_Package_Publisher.MSIPropertyReader.Column.Description
member.summary: A description of the data that is stored in the column.

member.name: P:Wsus_Package_Publisher.MSIPropertyReader.Column.Order
member.summary: The order of the column within the table.

member.name: P:Wsus_Package_Publisher.MSIPropertyReader.Column.Values
member.summary: List of values contains in this Columns. This Property is fill by the 'GetAllMSIValueFromTable' method of the MsiReader Class.
